task.title: Creating the MDHT Runtime Library
task.shortdesc: This describes the steps for creating the java libraries from the MDHT models and packaging them up with the set of EMF and OCL run-time dependency libraries that are needed to provide a basic runtime library for using MDHT artifacts.

step.cmd: Open the MDHT Workspace containing the models for which the run-time environment is needed.
Right-click on one of the projects and select "Export…" from the menu.
Select "Deployable plug-ins and fragments" and then click on "Next".
Select the runtime projects that are to be exported as jar files
Enter a directory for where to place the jar files on the "Destination" tab. Under the Options tab, check the option ‘Qualifier Replacement’ Click on "Finish"
step.stepresult: This will create a jar file for each of the libraries in the location you specified. The current naming of the jar files will be <roject-name>_ <version>.<timestamp<.jar</stepresult>

steps.stepsection: Once the libraries are generated for the MDHT models, you will need some additional eclipse libraries in order to use these generated libraries in stand-alone mode. These libraries can be found in the eclipse environment. If you are using the all-in-one download, then these will be in the eclipse\plugins folder.

choices.choice:

org.eclipse.emf.common_2.6.0.v20100914-1218.jar
org.eclipse.emf.ecore_2.6.1.v20100914-1218.jar
